body.name: Anolon Ascend Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan/Skillet - Good for All Stovetops (Gas, Glass Top, Electric & Induction), Dishwasher & Oven Safe with Stainless Steel Handle, 12 Inch - Bronze

features: ELEVATED NONSTICK PERFORMANCE: No stick, no scratch, easy clean. Stop foods from sticking and burning with extra-reinforced nonstick inside and out that withstands scratching, chipping, peeling, and wear for a frying pan that cleans and maintains easily and beautifully.

PREMIUM DURABILITY: Hard anodized toughness with a thick, edge-to-edge stainless steel base for a nonstick skillet that works on any stovetop, including induction. Plus the versatility to go oven safe up to 500°F.

DESIGN WITH A DIFFERENCE: Unlike ordinary nonstick frying pans, Anolon Ascend is engineered to keep oil in the middle, directly under foods, so they don’t stick for incredibly even cooking, while larger cooking surfaces are ready for recipes that go all the way.
READY TO EXPLORE: A premium nonstick skillet for the experiential home chef features a two-tone, stay-cool handle that provides an easy grip to flip, tip, and toss.
SUBLIME COOKING: Flush rivets are coated with easy-clean nonstick to provide a completely smooth cooking surface and the frying pan is dishwasher safe for total convenience.
body.description: Elevate your cooking experience to new heights with Anolon Ascend Hard Anodized Nonstick Cookware. This impeccably designed nonstick frying pan features an extra-reinforced nonstick finish inside and out that withstands scratching, chipping, peeling, and wear. Tough, hard-anodized aluminum construction with a thick, edge-to-edge stainless steel base delivers fast, even heat, and unlike ordinary nonstick pans, is engineered to keep oil in the middle, directly under foods so they don’t stick for incredibly even cooking. For home chefs who don’t hold back, this versatile cooking skillet is oven safe to 500°F and suitable for all stovetops, including induction. Cook to fulfillment with a comfortable, two-tone, stay-cool handle that has completely flush double rivet connections and a dishwasher-safe, inside-out nonstick that easily wipes clean to keep your cookware looking newer, longer. Anolon Ascend: thoughtfully crafted cookware for the truly transcendent and fulfilling cooking experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars After trying 3 other pans, settled on this one
reviews.reviewText: I'm one of Those People who doesn’t want to spend a dime more than is necessary but still expects high-quality.In this particular case, I initially ordered a 10-inch T-Fal pan. However, it had a scratch on the top of the rim. I promptly returned it for a replacement, but it too came with a scratch on the top of the rim. It was packaged well, so I don’t think it came from the manufacturer like that. So, I returned that too.Next, I tried the PranzoElite pan. I read good reviews, and thought I’d give it a try. But, while it said it was 10-inch, it was actually 11-inches, which was annoying since I still had a 10-inch lid that I wanted to use. Also, the PranzoElite’s bottom wasn’t fully stainless steel, so it seemed to only work on one of my induction burners.I finally decided that it just wasn’t worth my time driving back and forth to the UPS store to try and save a few bucks and got this pan. And I’m glad I did.First of all, I’m glad that those poisonous substances were not used for this pan; that’s not optional.This pan’s full stainless steel bottom easily cooks on any of my induction burners, having no problems activating them.It appears very nicely made and is aesthetically pleasing. The stainless steel and brass-colored design looks nice together.The handle and pan seem pretty thick, and didn’t transfer any noticeable heat.I also like how, where the handle is riveted, it’s coated with a non stick surface there too; a lot of pans don’t do that and, thus, over time get a little grimy, in which case you’d have to take a metal pad to clean them and thus possibly scratch your nonstick pan. But not this one.I’ll adjust this review if it fails me in the near future. However, for now, I’m pretty happy with it overall, and look forward to using it for years to come.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This pan does exactly what they say it does. Things don’t stick and it truly is dishwasher safe. I have run it through my dishwasher a couple of times and it still works as advertised. I also really like that it is heavy and you can tell that it is well made and has some real metal in it not just a thin sheet. You pay for quality and that’s what you get with this. I plan to buy some more larger ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4 quart pot is a necessity.
reviews.reviewText: Analog ascend hard anodized nonstick. The best, the best . The nonstick works great . Whatever type of metal or combination of metals it’s made of transfers heat the best I’ve ever seen. A very small flame will keep food boiling with even heat across bottom of pot. Functions great And it’s beautiful. Turns out I made a very good choice. 👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well made very substantial pan is very non-stick and cooks very well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Take proper care of it and it should last a good while
reviews.reviewText: I've owned and used pretty expensive non-stick pans in the past (e.g., All-Clad) and they perform very well and will last a long time as long as they are used and cared for properly. Unfortunately, I am the only one in my family who consistently does that, and so even the best non-stick pans will start to fail after repeated abuse. So when I had to replace a 10 inch non-stick All-Clad (I got tired of wasting my breath with the pan abusers in the house), I decided to look for something that seemed pretty well made but not as expensive. After reading other reviews of the Analon pans, I decided to give one a try. Since doing so I have actually made some headway with the other members of the household (the worst perpetrator has moved on) and thus far this pan has held up quite well. One it does eventually wear out (they all do sooner or later even with proper care), I think I will have gotten my money's worth.

reviews.reviewText: Sturdy nonstick frying pan that’s just the perfect size and weight for cooking

reviews.reviewText: absolutely nonstick, dishwasher safe, beautiful finish - totally want to store out on my gas burner stove for all to see! (i added this to a ten piece set)
Love this frying pan. Nothing sticks. Easy to clean. Just have to get used to not cooking on high.
